channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: One day two of the Republican National Convention, Democrats probe whether Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's speech will violate ethics rules.
item.title: US election 2020 LIVE updates: RNC continues with Melania Trump, Mike Pompeo and Rand Paul to speak

item.description: For more than a century, Swarovski has churned out crystals in every imaginable shape and form. But the coronavirus pandemic has laid waste to its sprawling network of boutiques in now deserted shopping centres and airports around the world.
item.title: At Swarovski, cracks appear in the $3.3 billion crystal kingdom

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Aged care operators say national cabinet needs to bring forward promised new response centres, and are calling for $2 billion in annual funding.
item.title: COVID-19 aged care disaster could be repeated without more assistance, sector warns

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: The indignant football world demands action against social media abusers, but that only plays into their hands.
item.title: To mute the abusers, shut up

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide has passed 23.7 million, Johns Hopkins University data shows, while deaths from the virus have passed 815,000.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 149 COVID-19 cases as three Sydney schools close; Australian death toll jumps to 549

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Chris Rogers is determined to help ensure more Victorians become permanent fixtures in the Australian team after being appointed the state's new men's coach.
item.title: Rogers driven to get more Victorians into Australian team

item.description: The cases come a day after researchers in Hong Kong revealed that a 33-year-old man was reinfected with a different strain of the virus.
item.title: European scientists confirm two cases of reinfection, 'more likely'

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The AFL tribunal has cleared Richmond pair Nick Vlastuin and Dylan Grimes of staging, overturning the decision to fine them for their actions against Essendon.
item.title: AFL tribunal clears Grimes and Vlastuin of staging

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Businessman Mohammed Saab, 37, has been taken to hospital in a serious condition after shots were fired in a residential street in Sydney's south.
item.title: Man shot in suspected targeted attack in Sydney's south

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The Federal Court decision which has been claimed by the WA government as a win for its 'hard border' has set out the risks of opening up to states that have eliminated COVID-19.
item.title: Federal Court finds 'low or very low' risk to WA if hard border dropped to safe states

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Three men into one position seemingly doesn't fit. However, the Storm believe they can keep Cameron Smith, Brandon Smith and Harry Grant and still make it work.
item.title: 'We'll keep all three': Storm keen to retain Grant and both Smiths

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Lawyers for Melbourne Cup-winning trainer Darren Weir will today push to have his committal hearing relating to charges of conspiracy to defraud stewards and animal abuse held virtually.
item.title: Weir's lawyers to push for virtual committal hearing

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Adrian Schrinner says Brisbane should have had an Indigenous cultural centre "10 years ago" but talks over the years had stalled.
item.title: 'We are behind the times': Lord mayor promises $1m for cultural centre

item.dc:creator: Sandra Hall
item.description: With the rousing rhythms of a great pop song and a set of lyrics proclaiming a call to arms, Helen Reddy’s hit, I Am Woman, was the perfect anthem for the women’s movement in the 1970s.
item.title: Hear and see her roar

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Whitehaven, one of the nation's largest coal miners, has seen its profits nearly wiped out as coal prices collapsed in the pandemic.
item.title: Whitehaven profit slumps 95% as Australia's coal prices collapse

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Brisbane Broncos coach Anthony Seibold has announced his departure, saying said the decision would take effect "immediately".
item.title: 'No finger pointing': Seibold quits role with Brisbane Broncos

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Jill Hennessy refuses to tell a Parliamentary committee what Victoria's Solicitor-General advised government about extending the state of emergency by a year.
item.title: Attorney-General says not for her to reveal legal advice on state of emergency

item.description: High-end matrimonial services cater to the middle and upper class with costs varying. For a successful match families can expect to pay up to $6500.
item.title: A life coach, in-house astrologers: India's elite matchmakers reinvent age-old tradition

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia has pledged $80 million to a global push to ensure any future coronavirus vaccine is distributed cheaply and fairly in developing countries in the Pacific and South East Asia.
item.title: Australia commits $80m to global effort to ensure cheap access to coronavirus vaccine

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Ms Saffioti said the new project would help ease congestion on the causeway, which is used by an estimated 1900 pedestrians and 1400 cyclists each day.
item.title: New pedestrian bridge to be built connecting Victoria Park to CBD via Heirrison Island

item.description: The greenback continues to slide as markets look for direction on the US's fragile economic recovery.
item.title: US dollar under pressure before Powell's speech as economic concerns mount

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Just one person returned a positive result after 20,000 people were tested across Queensland on Tuesday.
item.title: One new COVID-19 case as Queensland breaks testing record

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The plan is a "once-in-a-generation commitment" to support koalas and other biodiversity in the fast-expanding housing zone in Sydney's south-west, the Planning Minister says.
item.title: $84m to support wildlife protection plan for Cumberland Plain

item.description: Philadelphia general manager Elton Brand said he doesn’t plan to trade either of his two top stars.
item.title: Embiid, Simmons won't be traded: 76ers

item.description: Many have marvelled at how Wall Street's tech giants have soared during the pandemic. It is a more impressive story in South Korea.
item.title: South Korea's 'seven princesses' are taking over the sharemarket

item.dc:creator: Kate Lahey
item.description: Waddle they think of next? Phillip Island Nature Park's inaugural live-streamed penguin parade attracted more than 771,00 viewers.
item.title: More than 770,000 people tune into Phillip Island penguin parade

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A criminal investigation has been launched into magnate Mark Simonds and his family's trip after the Queensland government revoked a quarantine exemption.
item.title: Melbourne millionaire's alleged yacht breach sparks criminal investigation

item.description: Sure, it's easy to pull into whichever supermarket you find first. But consciously choosing a locally-owned and supplied store supports your community
item.title: All the reasons you should support local business

item.description: Commissioner Stephen Hahn faces growing criticism after overstating the life-saving benefits of treating COVID-19 patients with convalescent plasma, as the Trump administration exerts more pressure on the agency to work with its political agenda.
item.title: US FDA chief apologises for overstating plasma effect on virus

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: Essendon have confirmed that spearhead Joe Daniher will make his long-awaited return from injury as the Bombers cling to faint hopes of playing in the finals.
item.title: It's go for Joe: Bombers confirm Daniher's return

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Anthony Seibold has announced his departure from the Brisbane Broncos, saying the decision would take effect "immediately".
item.title: The straw that broke Anthony Seibold's back: Broncos coach steps down

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and superquiz, Wednesday, August 26

item.description: The self-described computer nerd and a college dropout behind Fortnite is not backing down in his fight with tech giants.
item.title: Fortnite creator on a crusade against Apple and Google

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: The 2020/21 iteration of the popular music festival has been dumped.
item.title: Falls Festival takes a raincheck as COVID-19 cancels the party

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Diversified conglomerate Seven Group Holdings has delivered a 12 per cent rise in full year revenue to $4.56 billion, just ahead of market expectations.
item.title: Mining contract wins underpin Seven Group Holdings result

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: The club's Victorian-based members haven't been able to attend a match in person all season but reigning premiers Richmond have surpassed 100,000 members again.
item.title: Tiger Army roars: 100,000 members for a third straight season

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Health Minister Jenny Mikakos has revealed there have been another 24 coronavirus-related deaths in the past 24 hours as the daily case tally remained in triple digits.
item.title: Victoria records 149 new coronavirus cases as state's death toll rises by 24

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Labor Senator Deb O'Neill has used parliamentary privilege to air another complaint of sexual harassment at the troubled wealth giant.
item.title: 'I was treated like a criminal': Senator airs further AMP harassment claims

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: The AFL's decision to merge the NEAFL into the Victorian Football League but keep the VFL name has bemused NSW footy figures, including Swans chief executive Tom Harley.
item.title: 'I hope that was a slip-up': Swans baulk at 'VFL' name for new-look comp

item.description: The Detroit Lions made the decision not to train on Tuesday 'as a unit' as America deals with the fallout of another police shooting.
item.title: NFL side skips training after discussing Wisconsin police shooting

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Mr Kaftel borrowed money from former HIH director Rodney Adler without disclosing that he was an undischarged bankrupt.
item.title: Stanley Kaftel jailed for nine months over Rodney Adler deception

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Tips and race-by-race guide for Randwick on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Greg Callaghan
item.description: As a 12-year-old in Cairns, Marita Cheng dreamt of building a robot that would do her chores. Two decades later, the former Young Australian of the Year is turning some of that dream into a reality – but the machines she’s designing help others, not herself.
item.title: 'Mum told me to give back to the community': the young Australian creating robots for good

item.description: Forget big-bearded blokes in flannel shirts carving objects from wood. Tasmanian design today has a decidedly feminine edge.
item.title: Material girls: meet some of the Apple Isle's most intriguing designers

item.dc:creator: Terry Durack
item.description: My dining table is where I eat, listen, Zoom, do my tax and so much more. And I love it.
item.title: Remembering 25 years of exceptional table service

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Just as Anthony Seibold was being farewelled from Red Hill, the Gold Coast have extended the contract of coach Justin Holbrook.
item.title: As Seibold gets the sack, Titans extend Holbrook until end of 2024

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX 200 is 1.2% lower despite the S&P 500 and NASDAQ closing at all-time highs. Zip Co rose 22% on the launch of its Zip Business partnership with eBay
item.title: ASX slides back below 6100; Zip jumps 22% to new record

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: While the union will remain affiliated with the party, it says it will be a 'more potent force' outside of factional links just two months out from the state election.
item.title: CFMEU withdraws support for Queensland Labor's left
